Articles.Content:
[@Putnam](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/125984-putnam/) there's no rule, usually people are ~~too lazy~~ not inclined to create a github account and post issues there.

most users rather post issues in the forum thread because they most likely already have an account on the forum.

If you feel more comfortable with github issues I don't think anyone has problems with you opening them, in my opinion they are better since you can keep track of them easily, but that's just personal preference.

usually if you want to increase the chance of your bug being looked at a good thing is include all the information possible, you can read all about that some posts above this one when I was explaining which files to give for a proper bug report.

for this specific bug (the orbital decay when in orbit around kerbin in NH):

I can confirm this is a kopernicus bug and not a new horizons bug, it happens always when kerbin gets reparented (referenceBody != the center of the universe)

I have already taken the time of providing thomas all the files he needed to understand the issue, so you don't need to worry about that.

also, I would suggest you to at least wait untill 1.2 before attempting to fix the issue yourself, so you don't run the risk of making a fix that gets broken immediately after 1.2 gets released ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

And btw: the weird name in the NHReparent config breaks RemoteTech. Renaming it to Kirbin fixed the issue.

Hi, does your mod support Karbonite+? I'm looking for Karborundum on the new planets introduced by New Horizon, but it seems K+ is not procedurally generated like ore at the start of each game, but placed specifically only on Eve and Eeloo. Are you planning to introduce karborundum on any of the new planets?

Edit: Sorry, just saw that this bug was already reported.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-09-20T21:11:31Z" title="09/20/2016 09:11  PM" data-short="7 yr">September 20, 2016</time> by Levv**
the planets doesnt appear i use 1.2. pls help

> 
> 
> 8 minutes ago, ryan andrade said:
> 
> 
> the planets doesnt appear i use 1.2. pls help
> 

Quoting [@sarbian](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57146-sarbian/): No logs -> no support.

While I find that a bit of a rough way to say it, it's true - we'll need to know more to determine the cause of the problem. A good start would be uploading your modulemanager log and your ksp log.

But first, are you certain that you installed the mod (and it's dependencies) correctly?

Furthermore, you really shouldn't be using 1.2 for *playing*, there's a reason why it's in testing, it's not finished. In fact, I'd be surprised if the planets *had* shown up. Don't expect many mods to work with 1.2 yet.

That brings me to another point - are you certain that the version of Kopernicus you installed works with 1.2? I'm not even sure if there's a 1.2 version yet.

Hi. I started playing this mod and I really enjoy it. However, Serran looks different in my game than in all the pictures and videos I’ve seen of it. I’m not sure if its texture was changed in an update or if my game is bugged because Sonnah’s texture is not correct when I look at it in the main menu but it looks fine in-game and in the map view.

Here is what Sonnah looks like:

Spoiler

After taking this picture I resumed my save and when I returned to the menu it was fixed, but closing the game and opening it again made the glitch come back.

This is what Serran looks like in my game:

Spoiler

Could you please explain whether this is a bug or a new texture? Serran is one of my favorite objects in this mod, and I would want to make sure if this is a bug or not before traveling there.

[@lnanson](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/71069-lnanson/), you will need to upload pictures to a file sharing site and copy the link they provide into your posts here. Most are free. Imgur.com is an easy one to use, though occasionally buggy.

The community library says that New Horizons has been updated to 1.2 But the link takes me to the 1.1.2 release. I am guessing the library is wrong but I'd like to make sure. if New Horizons has been updated to 1.2 could someone direct me to the proper like. TY

That's a Kopernicus bug, not a New Horizons bug. Might want to ask [over there](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/140580-120-kopernicus).

Mind you, I just brought this up today myself, and was asked to test it, since nobody else had. As far as I can see, it's not fixed. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(") (Unless there really is something newly introduced that KillAshley can change in his configs in order to achieve the same reparenting effect in a different manner.)
